title: How to Turn Off AI Overviews in Google: 5 Tricks That Really Work

steps.title: Go to tenbluelinks.org in the Chrome app.
steps.content: Go to tenbluelinks.org in the Chrome app. If you're using an Android, iPhone, or iPad, you can use this quick trick to turn off Google AI overviews in the Chrome app. This method of turning off AI overviews uses Google's "web" filter, a feature Google implemented in 2024 to display traditional search results without AI and other enhanced features. [1] X Research source This site,Ten Blue Links, makes it super easy to set this AI-free version of Google as your default search engine. [2] X Research source If you only want to hide AI overviews for a few searches, jump down to Hiding AI with the Web Tab .

steps.title: Tap the three-dot menu and select New tab.
steps.content: Tap the three-dot menu and select New tab . If you're on an Android, the menu is the three vertical dots at the top of Chrome. On iPhone and iPad, the three horizontal dots are at the bottom-right.

steps.title: Search for anything on Google.
steps.content: Search for anything on Google. It doesn't matter what you search for, but it's important that you search for something in this new tab before you continue. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the three-dot menu and select Settings.
steps.content: Tap the three-dot menu and select Settings . This opens your Chrome settings.

steps.title: Tap Search engine.
steps.content: Tap Search engine . Now you'll see your default search engine options.

steps.title: Tap Google web in the "Recently visited" section.
steps.content: Tap Google web in the "Recently visited" section. This sets your default search engine as the AI-filtered version, facilitated by tenbluelinks.org . Even though you used Ten Blue Links to get the AI-free version of Google, your searches still go directly through Google. [4] X Research source You can restore the standard version of Google's search engine by returning to the list and selecting Google .

steps.title: Open your Chrome search engine settings.
steps.content: Open your Chrome search engine settings. A quick way to get there is to type or paste chrome://settings/searchEngines into the address bar and press Enter or Return . [5] X Research source You can also get there by clicking ⋮ at the top-right corner of Chrome and going to Settings > Search engine > Manage search engines and site search. You can use this method, which utilizes Google's web filter, to disable Google AI overviews on Windows, Mac, and Linux. [6] X Research source If you only want to turn off AI overviews for one search, jump down to Hiding AI with the Web Tab .

steps.title: Scroll down and click Add next to "Site search."
steps.content: Scroll down and click Add next to "Site search." This gives you the option to add a new search engine shortcut to Chrome. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Create an AI-free shortcut and click Add.
steps.content: Create an AI-free shortcut and click Add . Here's what you'll need to do: In the "Name" field, type a name for your shortcut like AI-Free Google . In the "Shortcut" field, type @web . In the "URL" field, type or paste this code: {google:baseURL}search?q=%s&udm=14 Click the Add button at the bottom to save your shortcut. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click the three dots ⋮ next to the shortcut and select Make default.
steps.content: Click the three dots ⋮ next to the shortcut and select Make default . This sets your default search engine as the AI-free version of Google. Now that Google AI overviews are disabled, you can search to your heart's content without seeing AI in the results. If you need to set your default search engine back to the standard, AI-filled version of Google, just return to your search settings, click the three dots next to Google, and select Make default .

steps.title: Go to tenbluelinks.org in Firefox.
steps.content: Go to tenbluelinks.org in Firefox. This website uses Google's official web filter to remove AI overviews from the search results page. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Right-click or control-click the address bar and select Add Google Web.
steps.content: Right-click or control-click the address bar and select Add Google Web . This adds a version of Google without AI overviews to your list of search engines.

steps.title: Click the menu ☰ and select Settings.
steps.content: Click the menu ☰ and select Settings . Now that you've added the website-only version of Google to your search engine list, you can make it your default search engine to get rid of AI overviews for good.

steps.title: Click the Search option.
steps.content: Click the Search option. It's in the left panel.

steps.title: Select Google Web from the "Default Search Engine" menu.
steps.content: Select Google Web from the "Default Search Engine" menu. Once you set Google Web as your default search engine, typing search terms into your browser's search bar will display results without AI overviews. You can return to the regular version of Google at any time by selecting Google from the menu. Even though you used Ten Blue Links to get the AI-free version of Google, your searches still go directly through Google. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Use the Web tab at the top of the search results page.
steps.content: Use the Web tab at the top of the search results page. After running your search, tap the Web tab at the top of the results page to hide the AI summary and see a traditional list of links to websites that match your query. In the Google mobile app, or when using Google in the web browser on your Android, iPhone, or iPad, tap the Web tab at the top of the search results page. If you don't see it, swipe left on the tabs below the search bar until it appears. On a computer, click the ⋮ More tab above the search results, then click Web .

steps.title: Open your uBlock Origin settings.
steps.content: Open your uBlock Origin settings. If you use the uBlock Origin browser extension to block ads , you can add a quick line to your filters to block AI overviews in Google. To access your settings, open the uBlock Origin extension and click the icon with three gears. uBlock Origin is no longer available in the Chrome webstore. If you're using Chrome, you'll only be able to use this method if you installed uBlock Origin before it was removed from the webstore. uBlock Origin is still available for other browsers, including Firefox. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Click the My Filters tab.
steps.content: Click the My Filters tab. It's at the top of uBlock Origin.

steps.title: Add the blocking filter and click Apply changes.
steps.content: Add the blocking filter and click Apply changes . On the first blank line in the filter list, type or paste this address: www.google.com###Odp5De Once you've saved your changes. uBlock Origin will hide AI overviews from Google every time you run a search.

steps.title: Is there a Chrome extension to block AI overviews on Google?
steps.content: Is there a Chrome extension to block AI overviews on Google? Google has blocked these types of extensions from running in Chrome, including the popular Hide Google AI Overviews extension.

steps.title: Can you block AI by adding a curse word to your searches?
steps.content: Can you block AI by adding a curse word to your searches? While adding a curse word to your query works for some searches, this is not a reliable way to turn off Google AI overviews. You might also wind up with some unexpected search results .

steps.title: Why is Google AI Overview enabled?
steps.content: Why is Google AI Overview enabled? While they used to be optional, AI overviews are now integrated into Google search in more than 200 countries. Even if you didn't elect to enable AI in Google, it's now Google's standard way of displaying search results. [12] X Research source

steps.title: How do I turn off AI summary on my iPhone?
steps.content: How do I turn off AI summary on my iPhone? If your iPhone supports Apple Intelligence, you may be seeing AI summaries of your text messages. To get rid of them, go to Settings > Apps > Messages and toggle off "Summarize Messages." [13] X Research source
